topic: How to document notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Transitioning Jupyter Notebooks to Production with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates a method to convert Jupyter notebooks into production-ready APIs using FastAPI in Python 3.12+, enhancing code organization and performance.
key_points: Convert Jupyter Notebooks to Python scripts for better execution control.
Leverage FastAPI, a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python.
Take advantage of type hints and PEP 523 (Async/Await) support in Python 3.12+ for more efficient code.
Integrate Jupyter widgets, where possible, using JavaScript libraries such as Dash or Voilà for interactive visualizations.

code_examples.code:
import jupyter_client
from IPython.display import display, HTML
def render_notebook(url: str):
    with jupyter_client.connect to_notebook_server(url=url) as client:
        output = client.execute_cell("")
        display(HTML(output['text/html']))

version_notes: This guide focuses on Python 3.12+, taking advantage of its new features like improved performance, async functions, and type hints.
Ensure you have FastAPI installed by running: pip install fastapi[all]
caveats: Jupyter widgets may require additional setup to work with FastAPI for interactive visualizations.
Converting notebooks to scripts can limit interactivity, making it essential to maintain a balance between simplicity and functionality.
